column2: NEW MEXICO DMV TEST
column4: New Mexico
column6: NM

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: School crossing
column6: Pedestrian crossing

column2: 2. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 3. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: reduces the effects of the alcohol.
column6: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.
column8: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.
column10: has no effect, they are different substances.

column2: 4. A flashing yellow light:
column4: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column6: is used at dangerous intersections.
column8: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 5. A driver who's being passed on the right and the left by many vehicles while driving in the center lane of an highway should:
column4: move to the lane on their left.
column6: move to the lane on their right.

column2: 6. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 7. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column6: wear approved helmets.
column8: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 8. When driving in fog, drivers should use high beam headlights.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 9. Drivers should always signal when:
column4: pulling out of a parking space.
column6: pulling into traffic from a parking area or alley.

column2: 10. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column4: they already are within the intersection.
column6: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.

column2: 11. Drivers should not sound their horn when:
column4: visibility ahead is limited.
column6: near blind pedestrians.

column2: 12. A curb painted red means:
column4: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.
column6: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off

column2: 13. If a vehicle is coming towards you at night with its high beams on, making it hard to see the road ahead, you should:
column4: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.
column6: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.
column8: look straight ahead towards the middle of the lane.

column2: 14. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: need to brake suddenly.
column6: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column8: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column10: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.

column2: 15. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column6: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column8: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column10: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Turn right or left
column6: Traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ends
column6: One-way street begins

column2: 18. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column6: they must turn around immediately.
column8: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column10: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 19. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column6: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: The same as a green light.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: No-passing zone
column6: Winding road ahead

column2: 21. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column6: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.
column8: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead
column6: Slippery road ahead

column2: 23. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: Pedestrians may turn right.
column6: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column8: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column10: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.

column2: 24. You may not park:
column4: on a crosswalk or marked bicycle lane.
column6: on a hill.
column10: within 200 feet of an elementary school.

column2: 25. In bad weather conditions, when visibility is low, drivers should:
column4: drive in the lane closest to oncoming traffic.
column6: speed up to get off the road quickly.
